Detailed Description

GIC CPU interface Structure.

Field Documentation

Uint32 CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::cpuId

CPU interfaces ID in GIC.

void* CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::cpuIntfBasePtr

Pointer to CPU Interface sub-module base address.

uintptr_t CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::eoiRegAddress

End of Interrupt Register address to read from Alias or non alias EOI register

CSL_ArmGicDistIntrf* CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::gicDist

User configurable parameters.

uintptr_t CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::iarRegAddress

Interrupt ack register to read from Alias area or non alias register for getting Interrupt ID from IAR register

Uint32 CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::initStatus

GIC CPU interface initialization status.

void(* CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::pDefaultIntrHandlers) (void *pUserParam)

Array of function pointers to hold call back functions for Interrupt handlers. This list will be used for calling the call back functions of interrupts.

void* CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::pDefaultUserParameter

Array to hold the user parameters passed during interrupt registration. The same will be passed to the corresponding interrupt handlers.

void(* CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::pIntrHandlers[CSL_ARM_GIC_MAX_INTR_NO])(void *pUserParam)

Array of function pointers to hold call back functions for Interrupt handlers. This list will be used for calling the call back functions of interrupts.

void* CSL_ArmGicCpuIntrf::pUserParameter[CSL_ARM_GIC_MAX_INTR_NO]

Array to hold the user parameters passed during interrupt registration. The same will be passed to the corresponding interrupt handlers.
